1459.question: How much is performance hurt when using too small amount of layers in encoder?

6-Table1-1.png: The performance is hurt when using too small amount of layers in encoder as indicated by the negative values in the 'Encoder (x4)' section for 'BEDU' and 'PBSMT'.</s>

When using a too small amount of layers in the encoder, the performance is significantly hurt. For instance, the 'encoder(128)' has a score of 71.44 on the WMT APE test set 2016, while the 'encoder(256)' has a score of 71.59, showing a slight improvement with more layers.</s>

1459.answer: comparing to the results from reducing the number of layers in the decoder, the BLEU score was 69.93 which is less than 1% in case of test2016 and in case of test2017 it was less by 0.2 %. In terms of TER it had higher score by 0.7 in case of test2016 and 0.1 in case of test2017.
